definition: to make up a prescription (of herbal medicine)
to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison

sentences.english: The doctor gave me a prescription for some medicine.
sentences.chinese: 醫生給我開了個去抓藥的處方。

sentences.english: A：I have to get this prescription for my son.
His inspiration, come up with a "imitative" strategy.
sentences.chinese: 東方朔靈機一動，想出一個“照方抓藥”的計謀。

sentences.english: Please take this prescription to the drugstore.
sentences.chinese: 請拿這個處方去藥房抓藥。

sentences.english: The hospital of traditional Chinese medicine installed a computer to fill prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 中醫醫院裝上了電子計算機來抓藥。
請按藥方幫我抓藥好嗎？

sentences.english: I need to fill a prescription.

definition: antipyretic (drug to reduce fever, such as sulfanilamide)
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
herbal plaster applied to a wound
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
to change one's mind/to go back on one's word
effective medicine for a specific condition/highly effective medicine
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
to force someone to do something
